To reauthorize the Asian Elephant Conservation Act of 1997.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E98)
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife, and Oceans.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote .
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 110-245.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 154.

action.text: Mr. Grijalva moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 465.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 323.

action.text: By Senator Boxer from Committee on Environment and Public Works filed written report. Report No. 110-212.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 12/6/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on July, 23 2007. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Asian Elephant Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2007 - Amends the Asian Elephant Conservation Act of 1997 to: (1) authorize appropriations for FY2007-FY2012 for such Act; (2) increase the amount that may be used for administrative expenses to carry out such Act; and (3) repeal provisions requiring the Secretary of the Interior to notify countries regarding the approval of conservation projects for Asian elephants.
